messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Immunization Exemptions
messages.msgSnippet: Brenda, In Calif. you simply turn over the form they give you to list their shot records and there is a small box that says that you can sign there if you
messages.messageBody:
Brenda,

In Calif. you simply turn over the form they give you to list their shot
records and there is a small box that says that you can sign there if you
consider yourself exempt for personal or religious reasons. No one ever
turns over the form to see that it is there because if you immunize you
simply sign the front portion. I would imagine most if not all states
have this waiver...she just has to keep asking for it.

"I'll See You On The Dance Floor!"
--Christy


"If you have one eye on yesterday, and one eye on tomorrow,
you're going to be cockeyed today." --Anon.

Subject: Immunization Exemptions

Does anyone have any links or info regarding getting past the vaccine bit
for
preschool? I have a friend who's trying to find an exemption and doesn't
know
where to start.

Thanks in advance,

Brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Immunization Exemptions
messages.msgSnippet: Brenda, Here a few links I found by doing a search. Information Maintained by the Office of Code Revision Indiana Legislative Services Agency
messages.messageBody:
Brenda,
Here a few links I found by doing a search.
Information Maintained by the Office of Code Revision Indiana Legislative
Services Agency
http://www.state.in.us/legislative/ic/code/title20/ar12/ch71.html
This one tells about how to get an exemption.
http://www.naturesbestnews.com/vaccines.htm
How have you guys been? Ill send you an email here soon :)
Indiana Tami

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Immunization Exemptions
messages.msgSnippet: In many places, immunizations are no longer required, but the schools will not tell parents this.  Tell her to ask for an immunization waiver, and if they
messages.messageBody:
In many places, immunizations are no longer required, but the schools will not tell parents this. Tell her to ask for an immunization waiver, and if they refuse, ask her doctor to write a letter about it, and call the health department about the routine of waivers.

Allison
